market_summary: Regime: MIXED (single-day tape only; no weekly 30/90d momentum fetched today by rule). Benchmarks green: SPY 689.43 (+0.72%), QQQ 608.81 (+0.89%).
Breadth/leadership (snapshot): Mega-cap growth participation positive (AMZN +2.59%, META +1.68%, NVDA +0.76%) while defensives/hedges also bid (GLD +1.97%); Energy lagged (XOM -2.22%).
Go/No-go: NO-GO for rebalance (rebalance due today = false; min spacing not met). Action = Do nothing; keep target portfolio unchanged.

thesis_damage_flags.why: Single-day relative weakness vs SPY/QQQ: XOM -2.22% while SPY +0.72% and QQQ +0.89% (2026-02-21 close snapshot). No tool-fetched news/fundamentals today to confirm cause (UNKNOWN).

thesis: Catalyst: Process gate—weekly rebalance spacing blocks changes today; preserve signal integrity until next eligible rebalance window with refreshed WEEKLY 30/90d momentum + ratios/news.
Factor edge: Avoid churn on a mixed leadership day (growth up, gold up, energy down). Let cross-asset signals (GLD bid vs XOM hit) develop before reallocating.
Variant view: Today’s GLD strength (+1.97%) alongside SPY/QQQ strength suggests hedges are still being paid for; maintaining the GLD ballast may be valuable if risk sentiment deteriorates intra-week.
risks: Macro: A sharp risk-off move before next rebalance could hit growth concentration (NVDA/META/AVGO/AMZN) despite today’s strength vs benchmarks.
Idiosyncratic: Earnings/guidance/regulatory developments for holdings are UNKNOWN today (no news pull allowed/used on non-rebalance day), so adverse surprises could emerge without warning.
Execution/liquidity: Waiting concentrates decisions into the next rebalance date; mitigate then by staged sizing and limiting turnover to highest score deltas.
falsifiable_checks: Next eligible rebalance (>= 7 days after 2026-02-20): require tool-verified WEEKLY history for all holdings from lookback_30d_start=2026-01-22 and lookback_90d_start=2025-11-23 plus SPY/QQQ; if any holding lacks history, do not add risk and prefer simplification only.

If XOM continues to lag SPY by >=3.0% cumulatively from 2026-02-21 close to next eligible rebalance close (tool-verified), escalate XOM to top replacement review; otherwise treat as normal volatility.
trade_of_the_day.why_now: Base: Not a rebalance day—expected edge does not clear turnover/trading-cost drag, so the optimal paper action is hold. Bull: Growth leaders participated (AMZN/META/NVDA up) with QQQ outperforming SPY, supporting staying with winners. Bear: GLD also surged, hinting hedging demand; keep diversification rather than reacting to one-day XOM weakness absent verified catalysts.
